snippet: The family of Harry Seggerman, an investment fund president, was told how to hide more than $10 million in foreign accounts to avoid paying United States taxes, a federal complaint claims.
abstract: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan claim that the family of investment fund president Harry Seggerman was told how to hide more than $10 million in foreign accounts to avoid paying United States taxes.
lead_paragraph: The family of Harry Seggerman, an investment fund president, was told how to hide more than $10 million in foreign accounts to avoid paying United States taxes, a federal complaint claims.
